channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Senate fails to approve extension of aid law
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: The Senate adjourned yesterday without passing the Bayanihan to Recover as One Act or the second part of the Bayanihan to Heal as One Act, meant to empower President Duterte to address the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Aviation industry guidelines on health standards out
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The transportation department has issued guidelines for the aviation industry to ensure that health standards and safe physical distancing are observed during flights.

item.title: ‘Anti-terror council should be composed of judges’
item.author: Roel Pareño
item.description: Members of the judiciary and not unelected officials should comprise the anti-terrorism council, the establishment of which is stipulated under the newly approved bill on detecting and fighting terrorism.

item.title: UN: Philippines anti-drug, security measures violate rights
item.description: The Duterte administration’s heavy-handed focus on countering national security threats and illegal drugs – exacerbated by harmful rhetoric from top officials – has resulted in serious human rights violations in the country, the United Nations Human Rights Office said yesterday.

item.title: Duterte firm on VFA termination
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: President Duterte has not changed his mind about terminating the Visiting Forces Agreement, Malacañang said yesterday, as it clarified that only the termination process of the treaty has been suspended.

item.title: DepEd conducts survey on new learning strategies
item.description: The Department of Education is conducting a survey on the capability of households to adopt learning strategies that will be utilized in lieu of traditional face-to-face classes.

item.title: UP jumps 30 spots in Asia university rankings
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: The University of the Philippines is now the 65th best among almost 500 higher education institutions in Asia, jumping 30 spots in the latest university rankings released by London-based Times Higher Education.

item.title: DOH resumes anti-malaria drug trial for COVID
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: Despite safety concerns raised by the World Health Organization on the anti-malaria drug hydroxychloroquine as possible treatment for coronavirus disease 2019, the Philippines is set to resume trials on the drug.

item.title: Roque takes back statement on bikes with sidecars
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Presidential spokesman Harry Roque Jr. yesterday backpedalled on his statement that motorcycles with sidecars had been allowed on national highways.

item.title: Drivers to get 3rd cash aid this month
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Jeepney drivers will be provided with the third tranche of cash assistance this month to help them and their families cope with the crisis caused by the coronavirus disease 2019, presidential spokesman Harry Roque said.
